tv.source-info-name: Pluto TV Space guide by TV

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: To the Moon - The Apollo program achieves its major objective. Dragon, Falcon and Spacex - New directions in re-usable spacecraft. Gaia- Mapping our galaxy in unprecedented detail.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Rebuilding Project Apollo - After the Apollo 1 disaster NASA resumes manned space flight. Orbiting Carbon Observatory 2 - Monitoring the Earth's Co2 levels in unprecedented detail. Zero Gravity Training - Parabolic flights.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Beyond Earth Orbit - The Apollo program takes bold new steps. IXV Re-entry Vehicle - Europe is working to perfect a re-entry vehicle. Galileo Satellites Lost and Found - Navigation satellites go into incorrect orbit.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Gemini Advances - NASA refines the techniques needed for rendezvous. Cassini at Saturn - In the Cassini probe's final years of activity, its handlers are asking it to do more complex and risky assignments.

programme.title: Meteorite Men: Wisconsin Fireball
programme.desc: The guys are on their way to the Northeast Astronomy Forum in New York for a personal appearance, when a large fireball is seen over rural Wisconsin. Geoff continues on to NEAF to hold down the fort, while Steve begins an all-night drive to the fall site.

programme.title: Meteorite Men: Sweden
programme.desc: Geoff and Steve cross the Arctic Circle on one of their most daring expeditions yet. With the help of a Swedish meteorite-hunting family, the guys attempt to uncover ancient space rocks that were transported by glaciers during the last Ice Age.

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Dark Side
programme.desc: Perhaps that American politician was right. There are indeed things we know we don’t know.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Fresh Eyes
programme.desc: Two new space telescopes are in orbit and completing their shakedown; Gaia and TESS they too will be joined by the James Webb Telescope.

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Astronauts
programme.desc: One hundred kilometres above the Earth’s surface lies an invisible frontier: the edge of space.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Getting There
programme.desc: Launching payloads into space is a very difficult task, historically rocket launches are the proverbial 'swords into ploughshares'.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Mars: Adapt Or Leave
programme.desc: As the latest successes and failures come and go Mars continues to give up her secrets.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Next Stop Mars
programme.desc: It has fired our imaginations for millennia, Mars, the God of War and the source of Man's science fictional demise.

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Planet Makers
programme.desc: From the beginnings of our Solar System four and half billion years ago there remains tantalizing clues to its evolution; remnent debris: asteroids and comets.

programme.title: RISING TIDES
programme.desc: The next generation of Earth observation satellites are now in place maintaining the continuity of long-term climate data, in particular the planets rising temperatures and related ocean levels.

programme.title: The New Frontier: OCEANS IN THE SKY
programme.desc: Juice and the Europa Clipper are two missions to our Solar System’s largest planet.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Slingshot
programme.desc: Sending probes throughout the solar system is a mathematicians dream and an engineers nightmare, sling shotting probes around other planets to arrive at their destination.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: The Beginning of the End - After the first Moon landing the Apollo science program was about to start in earnest but people were losing interest. Apollo Gets Complicated - New technology is added that extends the reach of the Apollo program.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Gemini: Docking and EVA - In the final phase of the Gemini program NASA struggles with docking and spacewalks. Curiosity Roving Mars - On the surface of Mars the Curiosity rover is changing the way we think about the red planet.

programme.title: Inside Outer Space: Episode 1: The Solar System
programme.desc: This is a series packed with space stories and information about our universe covering what we can see, how we can live in space and what science tells us about the past and the future as we journey inside out of space.

programme.title: Inside Outer Space: Episode 2: Moons
programme.desc: Come with us as we explore and unravel the mysteries of what lies beyond our planet Earth. This is a series packed with space stories and information about our universe covering what we can see.

programme.title: Inside Outer Space: Episode 3: Asteroids
programme.desc: Come with us as we explore and unravel the mysteries of what lies beyond our planet Earth. This is a series packed with space stories and information about our universe covering what we can see.

programme.title: Inside Outer Space: Episode 4: Black Holes
programme.desc: Come with us as we explore and unravel the mysteries of what lies beyond our planet Earth. This is a series packed with space stories and information about our universe covering what we can see.

programme.title: Inside Outer Space: Episode 5: Space Missions
programme.desc: Come with us as we explore and unravel the mysteries of what lies beyond our planet Earth. This is a series packed with space stories and information about our universe covering what we can see.

programme.title: Inside Outer Space: Episode 6: Fermi paradox
programme.desc: Come with us as we explore and unravel the mysteries of what lies beyond our planet Earth. This is a series packed with space stories and information about our universe covering what we can see.

programme.title: Inside Outer Space: Episode 7: The Milky Way
programme.desc: Come with us as we explore and unravel the mysteries of what lies beyond our planet Earth. This is a series packed with space stories and information about our universe covering what we can see.

programme.title: Inside Outer Space: Episode 8: Extravehicular Activity
programme.desc: Come with us as we explore and unravel the mysteries of what lies beyond our planet Earth. This is a series packed with space stories and information about our universe covering what we can see.
